sect2.title: Introduction to GNOME Virtual File System
sect2.para: The GNOME Virtual File System package contains virtual file system libraries. This is used as one of the foundations of the Nautilus file manager.

If you run ./configure --help for the complete list of dependency requirements and available parameters, you may notice a message about the package. This package is not required at build-time, and is only a run-time dependency. If gnome-mount is available at run-time, GNOME-VFS will use it. If it is not available, GNOME-VFS will fall back to using other mounting mechanisms.

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: --libexecdir=$(pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0)/lib/gnome-vfs-2.0: This parameter causes the libexec files to be installed in the preferred location of $GNOME_PREFIX/lib/gnome-vfs-2.0 instead of $GNOME_PREFIX/libexec.

--with-dbus-service-dir=/usr/share/dbus-1/services: Use this parameter if you linked HAL into the build and you want the gnome-vfs-daemon.service file installed in the default D-Bus location instead of in GNOME_PREFIX/share/dbus-1/services. See the information in the configuration section below if you don't use this parameter.
--with-hal-eject=PROGRAM: This parameter does not need to be passed if you have Eject or installed, as the eject program is used if gnome-mount is not installed.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: If HAL was linked into the build and GNOME is being installed in any location other than /usr, you should create a local D-Bus session configuration file so that the installed gnome-vfs-daemon.service file can be discovered by D-Bus.
